文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Berzelius, a Swedish chemist, produced impure zirconium powder by the reduction of potassium zirconium fluoride with sodium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Troost made an impure metal by reducing gaseous zirconium tetrachloride with magnesium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Lely and Hamburger first were able to produce pellets of malleable metal by reacting resublimed zirconium tetrachloride and sodium in a sealed bomb

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: zirconium tetrachloride sublimes at 331°C (628°F)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: zirconium tetrachloride can be liquefied only under a pressure of about 2.53 MPa (25 atm)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: As little as 0.2% oxygen will seriously interfere with the cold ductility of zirconium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: A typical reduction run in this equipment yielded about $1 . 6 \mathrm { \bf k g }$ (3.5 lb) of zirconium sponge.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: Ingots made from the powder were very hard due to contamination of the powder with oxygen during the leaching operation.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: the vapor pressure of $\mathbf { M g C l } _ { 2 }$ is given as $3 \ \mathrm { m m }$ (0.12 in.) $\mathbf { H } \mathbf { g }$ at $8 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $( 1 4 7 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: and $1 0 \ \mathrm { m m }$ (0.39 in.) $\mathbf { H } \mathbf { g }$ at $9 2 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ $( 1 6 8 8 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: the heating coils are turned on and maintained at $1 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $( 1 8 3 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F }$ until the interior temperature reaches $8 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $1 4 7 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: the sponge metal was melted in a non-consumable electrode arc furnace under a partial pressure of helium to produce button ingots 51 to $7 6 \mathrm { m m }$ (2 to 3 in.) in diameter and 12.7 to $1 9 . 1 \ \mathrm { m m }$ (0.5 to 0.75 in.) thick

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: purification and reduction retorts $7 0 . 5 \mathrm { c m }$ (27.75 in.) in inside diameter and $1 7 7 . 8 \mathrm { c m }$ (70 in.) high

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: purification furnace (Fig. 3) operating on a $2 8 { \cdot } \mathbf { h }$ cycle

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: distillation step to operate on a $6 0 \mathrm { - h }$ cycle

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: reduction crucibles, formerly made of mild steel, were made of $1 4 \%$ chromium-iron to reduce iron pickup in the sponge and to increase crucible life

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: Average batch size was increased from $6 1 . 2 \mathrm { k g }$ (135lb) in 1950 to $7 9 . 4 \mathrm { k g }$ (175 lb) by 1955

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: After several evacuation cycles with the furnace controls set at $3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $( 5 7 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: The average time for a PR cycle was about $4 1 \%$ n compared with a total furnace time of about $6 4 \mathrm { ~ h ~ }$ for separate purification and reduction runs

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: The heated sections of the distillation retorts (Fig. 7) in this plant were constructed of Type 316 stainless steel, $1 2 . 7 ~ \mathrm { m m }$ (0.5 in.) thick

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: Carborundum Metals Co. 226 800 kg 500 000 lb 3.50 per kg 7.72 per lb

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: The reduction crucible was tapered from $1 4 2 . 2 \mathrm { c m }$ (56 in.) in diameter at the top to $1 3 4 . 6 \mathrm { c m }$ (53 in.) diameter at the bottom

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: the distillation retort, which operates under vacuum at a temperature of about $9 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $( 1 6 5 2 ^ { \circ } \mathsf { F } )$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: The zirconium tetrachloride was purified by dissolving it in a molten-salt bath, then pumping the resulting salt mixture into a vaporizer, where the tetrachloride was vaporized and then condensed in another vessel.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: Filtered liquid sodium and solid zirconium tetrachloride were metered into a continuous reactor where $\mathbf { Z r C l } _ { 2 }$ and NaCl were formed at a temperature of about $2 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ $( 3 9 2 ^ { \circ } \mathsf { F } )$ .

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: The pots were then placed in floor furnaces and heated to several hundred degrees, at which point the second reduction reaction proceeded to reduce the $\mathbf { Z r C l } _ { 2 }$ to metallic zirconium, exothermically raising the temperature of the pot to a red heat.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: After several hours of soaking, the pots were removed from the furnace, allowed to cool, and then opened.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: A jackhammer was used to break the reaction mass and salt out of the pot, after which the mass was crushed to $6 \ \mathrm { m m } \ ( 0 . 2 5 \ \mathrm { i n } )$ size and leached with water.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: However, after leaching, the sponge still contained about $1 / _ { 2 } \%$ NaCl and some sodium; hence, it would not meet AEC specifications.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: The sponge was compacted into an electrode and fed through an induction coil in an inert atmosphere, and the molten zirconium was allowed to drip on to a rotating disk.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: At first, "platelets" about I in. $( 2 . 5 4 \mathrm { c m } )$ in diameter were formed by this process, but these were difficult to compact into consumable electrodes for arc melting.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: Finally, the melting rate was speeded up so that "chunklets" were formed, and these proved highly satisfactory.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: the sodium zirconate can be dissolved in sulfuric acid $\mathrm { ( H } _ { 2 } \mathbf { S } \mathbf { O } _ { 4 } )$ hydrochloric acid (HCl), or nitric acid $\left( \mathrm { H N O } _ { 3 } \right)$ to provide whatever solution is required for further processing.
介质: sulfuric acid, hydrochloric acid, nitric acid

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: the major application of zirconium as a structural material in nuclear reactor cores demands that the hafnium content be reduced to below 100 ppm and, for some applications, below 50 ppm.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: the thermal neutron absorption cross section of hafnium at 105 barns is almost 600 times as great as that of zirconium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: the need to also produce a hafnium product with a zirconium content of $2 \%$ or less.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: The aqueous zirconium raffinate is diluted to a zirconium content of about $_ { 1 2 \mathrm { ~ g ~ } }$ /litre (0.1 lb/gal)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: Zirconium is extracted from the feed liquor with a 50% solution of tributyl phosphate in n-heptane

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: solvent previously equilibrated with 8-M HNO3

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: Hafnium and impurities are back-scrubbed with HNO3

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: The solvent is scrubbed with deionized water to recover the zirconium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: Both metal product streams are distilled to recover free nitric acid, and neutralized to precipitate the hydrates, which are then calcined to the oxides

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: TBP-nitric acid process is capable of producing a high-purity zirconium product with low hafnium content

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: Kim and Spink at Waterloo University... patented a method to separate HfCl4 from ZrCl4 in a molten-salt solution by a distillation technique at 101.3–kPa (1 atm) pressure
介质: molten eutectic of zirconium tetrachloride, sodium chloride, and potassium chloride

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: crude zirconium tetrachloride is selectively reduced by zirconium or zirconium dichloride at 420°C (788°F)

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: hafnium tetrachloride and any unreacted zirconium tetrachloride can be sublimed away at 200 to 300°C (392 to 572°F) in a vacuum

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk8
证据片段: These vapors may contain up to 30% hafnium tetrachloride

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: The eutectic salt, which melts at $4 5 0 \mathrm { { \circ C } }$ $( 8 4 2 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )$ , is obtained when using bimetallic reductant containing 58.8 weight $\%$ sodium and 41.2 weight $\%$ magnesium

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: any metal mixture containing 24.9 to 74.2 weight $\%$ sodium brings the melting point of the resulting salts down below the melting point of magnesium, which is $6 5 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: The heat of reaction, when using sodium as a reductant for $\mathbf { Z r C l _ { 4 } }$ , is 124.6 kcal/mol versus 37.4 when using magnesium.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: residual by-product salt mixtures can be more readily removed from the sponge by vacuum distillation than salts from either sodium- or magnesium-reduced sponge.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: The ram reactor consisted of a $1 5 . 2 – \mathrm { c m }$ -diameter (6 in.) vertical tube

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: The zirconium metal compact consists of a $1 5 . 2 – \mathsf { c m }$ -diameter (6 in.) cylinder of finely divided zirconium metal uniformly distributed in a matrix of salt and excess magnesium metal.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk10
证据片段: The compacts were vacuum-distilled before melting but still contained much higher residual salt levels than conventional Kroll process sponge

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk11
证据片段: Steinberg and coworkers [50-52] showed that zirconium, in a form suitable for subsequent processing into ductile massive metal, could be electrowon from K₂ZrF₆ dissolved in molten NaCl-KCl mixtures

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk11
证据片段: The process was scaled up [51] to produce 1.8 to 2.7 kg (4 to 6 lb) per hour of zirconium using a bath containing 25 to 35 weight % K₂ZrF₆ in NaCl

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk11
证据片段: High current densities and temperatures of 850 to 900°C (1562° to 1652°F) yielded the optimum results, producing coarsely granular zirconium powder

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk11
证据片段: High current densities and temperatures of 850 to 900°C (1562° to 1652°F) yielded the optimum results, producing coarsely granular zirconium powder

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_004_chunk12
证据片段: a new process based on extractive distillation of zirconium chloride (ZrCl4) and hafnium chloride (HfCl4) in a solvent made of molten potassium chloride-aluminum chloride (KCl-AlCl3) mixture above 350°C at atmospheric pressure
